alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Lee; Phillips; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 12:29AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lee, southeastern St. Francis, northeastern Phillips, southwestern Crittenden, northwestern DeSoto and northern Tunica Counties through 100 AM CST... At 1229 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marianna, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marianna, Hughes, Helena-West Helena, Edmondson, Horseshoe Lake, Lexa, Anthonyville, Simsboro, Brickeys, Pinckney, Robinsonville, Lagrange, Cody, Clack, Browns, Haleside, Commerce, Soudan, Beck and Democrat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
